CBAAC mourns Ijebu monarch, Oba Adetona
Published by
The Sun
on Thu, 17 Jul 2025
The Centre for Black and African Arts and Civilization (CBAAC) has extended its condolences to the family and people of Ijebu following the passing of the Awujule of Ijebu, Oba Sikiru Adetona. In a statement signed by its Director-General, Aisha Adamu Augie, CBAAC described the monarch as a cultural icon whose leadership and contributions to []The post CBAAC mourns Ijebu monarch, Oba Adetona appeared first on The Sun Nigeria.
Click here to read full news..

author: Constant MÃ©heut
title: Russia pushes forward in Ukraineâ€™s east as Kursk offensive slows - The Boston Globe
text:
KYIV â€” More than two weeks into its surprise offensive in western Russia, Ukraineâ€™s advance has slowed, with its troops making only marginal gains around territory they already control.
But more than 200 miles to the southeast, another offensive is gaining momentum: Russiaâ€™s drive toward Pokrovsk, a stronghold in Ukraineâ€™s eastern Donetsk region. In recent days, Russiaâ€™s troops have seized at least three settlements and reached the outskirts of a town along a railroad to Pokrovsk, a logistics hub for the Ukrainian army in the region.
The Russian advance has put the Ukrainians in the precarious position of defending one critical front while attempting to press forward on another, all with limited troop numbers and weaponry. President Volodymyr Zelensky said this week that Ukraine was working on boosting its forces in the east with more men and weapons to resist the Russian advance.
Advertisement
Russiaâ€™s troops are now about 8 miles from the center of Pokrovsk.
â€œTheyâ€™re now within artillery range of the city,â€ Michael Kofman, a senior fellow in the Russia and Eurasia program at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, told the military podcast War on the Rocks on Wednesday.
Pokrovsk, a city of more than 40,000 inhabitants, is a transit hub for Ukrainian forces in the east. It is on a key road, Highway T054, linking several cities that form a defensive arc protecting the part of the Donetsk region that is still held by Ukraine.
â€œThe loss of Pokrovsk would be fairly significant to Ukraineâ€™s ability to maintain defenses overall in Donetsk,â€ Kofman said. â€œIts loss wouldnâ€™t be disastrous but it would have downstream effects for the overall organization of defense.â€
A map of the battlefield produced by the Finland-based Black Bird Group, which tracks developments in the conflict, appears to indicate that Russian troops have approached the final line of Ukrainian anti-tank ditches and trenches near the town. They have already breached several defensive layers during their advance, the Black Bird Group said, although these were less densely fortified.
Local Ukrainian authorities have called on Pokrovskâ€™s residents to evacuate within the next two weeks, before conditions worsen significantly. Families with children have already been ordered to leave. But Serhii Dobriak, the head of Pokrovskâ€™s military administration, reported that the evacuation pace was not fast enough, with only 500 to 600 people departing daily, though the authorities could bring out at least 1,000 a day.
Advertisement
â€œPeople donâ€™t want to evacuate,â€ Volodymyr Nikulin, a police officer in Pokrovsk, said in a text message. â€œThis is not a surprise. People in these cities used to live in war since 2014. Theyâ€™ve experienced so many war atrocities. They just hope to survive.â€
To the northeast of Pokrovsk, around the towns of Toretsk and Niu-York, Russian forces have been slowly but steadily gaining ground, sending waves of troops in bloody attacks.
Footage geolocated by the Institute for the Study of War, a Washington-based think tank, shows Russiaâ€™s troops are on the doorstep of Toretsk and now control most of Niu-York, which took its name in the 19th century and is sometimes referred to as New York. A medic from a brigade fighting near Niu-York, speaking on condition of anonymity for security reasons, said this week that Ukrainian soldiers still controlled a small part of the town but were under relentless attacks.
Ukrainian positions in Niu-York and Toretsk protect another city in the defensive arc: Kostiantynivka, about 9 miles to the northwest.
Analysts say one aim of Ukraineâ€™s offensive into western Russia has been to force Moscow to divert troops from the eastern front lines. But the Kremlin appears to have largely resisted such a redeployment, prioritizing its military effort in the east.
â€œThe Russians have hardly moved any forces from here,â€ Maksym Zhorin, the deputy commander of the Third Separate Assault Brigade, which is fighting in the east, told Ukrainian media Wednesday. The Ukrainian offensive in Russia has had little impact on the fighting in the Donetsk region, he said.
Advertisement

author: @Goncalvesgb_
title: AnÃ­bal Moreno analisa vitÃ³ria contra o Fluminense: "Circulamos a bola"
text:
O Palmeiras teve mais um resultado importante para a briga pela lideranÃ§a do Campeonato Brasileiro ao bater o Fluminense, fora de casa, por 2 a 1. ApÃ³s a partida, AnÃ­bal Moreno conversou com a imprensa e analisou a partida.
â€œSabÃ­amos que o Fluminense se defende muito bem. NÃ³s fizemos um grande jogo, circulamos a bola. O primeiro gol saiu assim, com paciÃªncia. No segundo foi mais a postura do time e o VÃ­tor fez um belo golâ€, disse.
AlÃ©m disso, AnÃ­bal Moreno tambÃ©m comemorou o gol de VÃ­tor Roque, que foi decisivo no confronto e marcou o segundo gol da vitÃ³ria.
â€œEle fez uma grande partida, estÃ¡ ajudando muito. Hoje foi por causa dele, fizemos uma pressÃ£o muito boa e ele conseguiu o golâ€, comentou.
AlÃ©m do jogador, Abel Ferreira tambÃ©m falou sobre a fase de atacante e chamou as crÃ­ticas sofridas pelo atleta de â€œselvagensâ€.
â€œQuem teve que ouvir foi ele. Ele jÃ¡ sabe. Para ser jogador nessa paÃ­s e aguentar as crÃ­ticas selvagens que fazem a jogadores com 20 anos, independente se ganham muito ou pouco, chamam de bagre. Tem Ã³dio. Isso deixam marcas emocionais nos jogadores. Estamos a falar de um jogador que Ã© capaz, e como nÃ³s parece que vivemos em um mundo perfeito, que todo mundo faz tudo perfeito no trabalhoâ€, declarou.

author: Reuters and Algemeiner Staff
title: Israel â€˜Prayingâ€™ Medicines Brought to Gaza Will Reach Hostages - Algemeiner.com
text:
Israeli President Isaac Herzog looks on during a meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, not pictured, in Washington, DC, on October 25, 2022. Stefani Reynolds/Pool via REUTERS
Israel is praying that an emergency shipment brought to the Gaza border through Egypt, in a deal arranged by Qatar and France, will reach hostages held by Hamas in the besieged Palestinian enclave, Israel i President Isaac Herzog said on Thursday.
â€œWe are praying that all the medication â€¦. will reach them, but thatâ€™s only the beginning,â€ Herzog told the World Economic Forum in Davos, sitting next to a picture of the youngest of the 132 hostages, one-year-old Kfir Bibas.
Herzog, whose role is largely ceremonial, repeated his governmentâ€™s stand that the Gaza war must result in the removal of the ruling Palestinian Islamist faction Hamas, which carried out a shock cross-border rampage in southern Israel on Oct 7.
While saying he was not shying away from the â€œhuman tragedyâ€ inflicted on Gaza civilians, Herzog cast the Israel i offensive as a step towards more peaceful relations with the Palestinians in the future, and as bolstering global security.
Herzog called on world powers to help in post-war Gaza and noted that, before the Hamas attack, Israel had been on a path to establishing relations with Saudi Arabia after doing so in 2020 with Gulf neighbors United Arab Emirates and Bahrain.
â€œWe all understand that there has to be a vision, and I think part of it should be also going back to the normalization process of Israel and its neighbors in the region. I think itâ€™s part of a package,â€ he said.
â€œBut that requires to support Israel â€˜s efforts to undermine the capabilities of Hamas, and itâ€™s still there.â€

author: (abc)
title: 'La Revuelta' entona el 'mea culpa' por un 'gravÃ­simo' error: Â«Cruzamos una frontera que no nos podemos permitirÂ»
text: 'La Revuelta' entona el 'mea culpa' por un 'gravÃ­simo' error: Â«Cruzamos una frontera que no nos podemos permitirÂ» El programa de Broncano ha recibido a Bad Gyal. La cantante espaÃ±ola acaba de estrenar su propio documental ['La Joia: Bad Gyal', la historia del lanzamiento de su primer Ã¡lbum](https://www.abc.es/play/cine/joia-bad-gyal-historia-lanzamiento-primer-album-20241024093906-vi.html) 'La Revuelta' mantiene en alto secreto la identidad de sus invitados cada noche, si bien es cierto que el nombre de la famosa que acudiÃ³ este jueves 24 de octubre resonaba fuerte desde hace semanas y era la ocasiÃ³n perfecta para que darle esa satisfacciÃ³n a sus fans. Alba Farelo i SolÃ©, conocida por todos como [Bad Gyal, acaba de estrenar 'La Joia'](https://www.abc.es/play/cine/joia-bad-gyal-historia-lanzamiento-primer-album-20241024093906-vi.html), un documental que sigue a la popular cantante desde la vertiginosa salida de su primer Ã¡lbum. Hubo ademÃ¡s un cruce de invitados. Juan Enrique Soto, policÃ­a, psicÃ³logo, divulgador y analista de conductas criminales que trabajÃ³, entre otros, en el caso BretÃ³n, presentÃ³ la serie documental 'SAC: En la mente criminal,' que se estrena en RTVE Play el prÃ³ximo 30 de octubre. Sensacional cruce de invitados este. De los mejores momentos de la temporada, si me preguntan. â€” La Revuelta (@LaRevuelta_TVE)[#LaRevuelta][@bad_gyal_pussy][@JuanEnriqsoto][pic.twitter.com/7rcoph0j1q][October 24, 2024] Antes de recibir en platÃ³ a los invitados intervino como es[ habitual, Jorge Ponce](https://www.abc.es/espana/madrid/jorge-ponce-revoluciona-true-crime-realidad-vestida-20241019122030-nt.html). Sin embargo, esta vez se trataba de Â«una cosa cortita, rÃ¡pida y de poco chisteÂ», anunciaba apesadumbrado el colaborador, nada que ver con la ironÃ­a y el sarcasmo que se gasta normalmente. Tanto es asÃ­ que el propio Broncano le recordÃ³ que Â«aquÃ­ prima el chisteÂ». Â«Hay veces que no se puedeÂ», espetÃ³ Ã©l. Â«Entramos en temas polÃ­ticos a veces, hemos traÃ­do a Jordi MollÃ¡, otras tiramos de la cuerdaâ€¦ Pero ayer cruzamos una frontera que no nos podemos permitir; ni hacerlo, ni hacer como si no hubiera ocurridoÂ», afirmaba Ponce con severidad. Â«Al final del programa actuÃ³ Dani FernÃ¡ndezÂ», empezÃ³ contando. A lo que aÃ±adiÃ³ que Â«se hizo un corte de ediciÃ³n y se puso un rÃ³tulo para indicarloÂ». La 'vergÃ¼enza' de Broncano por lo sucedido con la ediciÃ³n El presentador, en ese momento, ya supo de quÃ© se tratabas. Â«Haces bien en decirlo, esto es gravÃ­simo. No nos podemos equivocar asÃ­Â», sentenciaba. El error en cuestiÃ³n era que se les habÃ­a escapado un 'trÃ¡s' en el rÃ³tulo, con tilde en la 'a'. Â«Yo me avergÃ¼enzo, y no es bromaÂ», manifestaba el cÃ³mico manteniendo el mismo tono serio. Ponce seguÃ­a con la flagelaciÃ³n. Â«Es mearse encima de las preposiciones. Y eso porque estamos en La 1, si estuviÃ©ramos en La 2 nos habrÃ­an cancelado ya el programaÂ», bromeaba.
